titleStmt.title: S. A. Spencer to James F. Robinson
CWG7828

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Greensburg Green County Ky
Decr 15. 1862
To His Excellency James F Robinson Esqr
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

Owing to the death of one of Our Justices of the peace for this county. (C. H. Craddock Esqr) who recently died.. being a Justice of District No 3 of this county...there is a vacancy in said office -- I respectfully recommend to your Excellency.. James Whitlock. a resident of said District as a suitable person to fill said office Mr Whitlock is a man that Stands deservedly high in the Community. for honesty. integrity & good deportment. he is a sound & reliable union man. and one altogether acceptable to the Union men of this County
I therefore hope that it may meet your Excellencys desires of propriety to make this appointment.

I have the honor to be
Very respectfully
Your obed Sevnt
S. A. Spencer Presiding Judge Green Co Court

Green Co
J. P.
Dist No 3
Jas Whitlock
Appd Decr 18. 1862
